description:
No instructions for reported command line use, 'fx' command is taken by system utils, does not automatically integrate into system, and doesn't seem to modify existing text editors / IDE's for enhanced JSON file viewing. Was expecting some sort of tree sort view, but I guess it's just supposed to colorize things? Which is useful, but it doesn't even seem to do that--or, perhaps it does; but I have no way of accessing it. Promising software, though.

Ubuntu Bionic Linux 5.3.0

Just use VIM instead
For Example:

vim package.json

I love this viewer. It folds up the java, and you navigate, expand, and collapse with a single keystroke. It colors and indents too. I love Vim and folding, but this works much better than the Vim plugins I've tried.

As far as I can tell this may possibly be usefull if you write in an environment that has little JSON support, like a JAVA IDE or somthing.
Really isn't much need for a tool like this. IDK why its listed above other highly usefull IDE's, Editors, Language support, Graphics editing software, etc... in the dev section of the Ubuntu Apps store, but what do I know.
summary: Why bother when I can get an extension for my IDE that's 1000x better
